meanings.definition: Persuades or entices someone to do something through deception or flattery.
meanings.sent1: She inveigles her friends into sharing their snacks with her during lunchtime.
meanings.sent2: He always inveigles his way into getting what he wants by sweet-talking everyone.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox inveigles the rabbit into believing he is just playing a harmless game.
meanings.sent4: The sly salesman inveigles customers into buying unnecessary products with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent5: Her smile inveigles even the toughest critics into giving her a chance.

meanings.definition: Uses charm or trickery to manipulate or persuade someone.
meanings.sent1: The magician inveigles the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent2: She inveigles her way out of trouble by using her wit and charm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat inveigles the dog into chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: His silver tongue inveigles even the most skeptical listeners into believing his stories.
meanings.sent5: The con artist inveigles unsuspecting victims into parting with their money through elaborate schemes.
